description: Ultimately from Old English būr, from Proto-Germanic *būraz. Cognate with German Bauer (“birdcage”), Old Norse búr, (whence Danish bur, Swedish bur (“cage”)). Equivalent to en- +‎ bower.

verbs.description: embower (third-person singular simple present embowers, present participle embowering, simple past and past participle embowered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, poetic) To enclose something or someone as if in a bower; shelter with foliage.
(intransitive) To lodge or rest in or as in a bower.
examples: But the small birds in their wide boughs embowring / Chaunted their sundrie tunes with sweete consent;
